Article Title: After Haris Rauf, PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi gets into jet downing controversy during Asia Cup match
Article Text:

'My job is to play': Haris Rauf stays calm as Pakistan ride out Asia Cup drama

Poll Do you think political posturing is overshadowing sportsmanship in cricket? Yes No

The Asia Cup has once again become a stage for political posturing rather than cricket . Pakistan Cricket Board chairman Mohsin Naqvi has sparked outrage after posting a video of Cristiano Ronaldo making a fighter-jet gesture. The act is being seen as a deliberate provocation and an attempt to legitimise behaviour that has already drawn heavy criticism.This comes on the heels of Haris Rauf’s controversial ‘6-0’ and fighter-jet gesture during the Super Four clash against India in Dubai. Rauf’s actions, aimed at Indian fans chanting “Kohli, Kohli,” were slammed across social media as cheap, classless, and unbecoming of an international cricketer. Adding to the embarrassment, Sahibzada Farhan mimicked firing a gun with his bat, showing how quickly Pakistan ’s players turned a sporting contest into a theatre of political provocation.Instead of calming matters, Naqvi has only worsened the situation. A board chairman using Ronaldo’s image to back such behaviour has shocked fans, who expect administrators to rise above pettiness. Pakistan cricket, instead of focusing on its on-field struggles, is hiding behind provocative symbolism that damages the spirit of the game.While Pakistan wrestles with controversy, India have done their talking on the pitch. Abhishek Sharma ’s sparkling 75 set up a strong total, and Kuldeep Yadav alongside Varun Chakravarthy dismantled Bangladesh to seal a 41-run win on Tuesday. With this result, India stormed into the Asia Cup final, knocking out Sri Lanka and leaving Pakistan to battle Bangladesh in a virtual semifinal for the remaining spot.Naqvi’s actions, however, have ensured that Pakistan’s cricket remains in the headlines for the wrong reasons.

Article Title: "He can’t bring me down": Dak Prescott responds after Micah Parsons warns it will be ‘painful’ to sack him in reunion game
Article Text:
Former teammates turn rivals as Dak Prescott answers Micah Parsons’ bold ‘painful sack’ threat (Imagn Images)

Micah Parsons vs Dak Prescott: A battle of respect and rivalry



Cowboys seek stability without Parsons in critical matchup



When Micah Parsons steps back into AT&T Stadium this Sunday wearing Green Bay colors, the spotlight won’t just be on his talent—it will be on his bond with former teammate Dak Prescott. The star pass rusher, now with the Packers, made it clear he plans to get after Prescott, even if it comes at a personal cost.Parsons admitted the matchup carries weight beyond football. “It’s going to be painful,” he said of sacking Prescott. “That’s my guy. He was always like a good mentor for me. But you know how it is. He always told me if I ever faced him that it'll be a great matchup, so I’m excited to see what Sunday brings itself.”Prescott, though, is hoping the “pain” doesn’t fall on him. With five sacks already allowed in three games, Dallas faces an even tougher challenge without two key linemen and top receiver CeeDee Lamb. Still, Prescott trusts his line and his preparation: “I hope it’s not (painful) for me. And I hope he doesn’t get to me… Just getting to go out there and compete with a guy that’s a good friend… I’m excited to go and have that matchup.While Parsons is eager for a “revenge” game, it’s not rooted in animosity. During his contract standoff with the Cowboys, Prescott and other teammates openly supported him. That respect has carried into this week, even as the Packers defense—with Parsons and Rashan Gary—enters the matchup with a league-leading 10 sacks.The Cowboys, meanwhile, continue to feel Parsons’ absence. Their defense has managed only four sacks this season while giving up explosive plays through the air. Defensive coordinator Matt Eberflus acknowledged the chatter around Parsons but insisted, “Our eyes are forward. We have guys in the building that we’re coaching, guys are working their tail off.”Prescott praised the Packers’ pass rush, calling it “great” and stressing how it changes the rhythm of a game. Yet, he downplayed the personal storyline. “This is Dallas Cowboys vs. the Green Bay Packers, and we’ve got to go get a win.”For fans, however, the duel between Parsons and Prescott is unavoidable. It’s a clash of friendship, loyalty, and competition—one that could define Sunday’s outcome.Also Read: Tory Horton emerging as Seattle’s breakout star and earning Justin Jefferson comparisons
Article Summary: Parsons admitted the matchup carries weight beyond football. The star pass rusher, now with the Packers, made it clear he plans to get after Prescott, even if it comes at a personal cost. Prescott, though, is hoping the “pain” doesn’t fall on him.

Article Title: Tory Horton emerging as Seattle’s breakout star and earning Justin Jefferson comparisons
Article Text:
Tory Horton (Imagn Images)

Rookie Tory Horton makes an early impact on offense and special teams

Why Tory Horton’s rise matters for Seattle’s offensive identity

The Seattle Seahawks took a bold step this offseason by parting ways with veterans Tyler Lockett and DK Metcalf, signaling a new era for their passing game. While many expected Jaxon Smith-Njigba and Cooper Kupp to dominate early on, it’s rookie wide receiver Tory Horton who is stealing headlines with his dynamic play.Through his first games in the NFL , Horton has been making the most of his opportunities. He has converted eight targets into five receptions for 64 yards and two touchdowns, proving himself to be a reliable red-zone weapon. Beyond his contributions as a receiver, he has also impressed on special teams with six punt returns totaling 156 yards.That dual-threat ability has not gone unnoticed by Seahawks offensive coordinator Klint Kubiak. Having worked closely with Justin Jefferson during his time with the Minnesota Vikings, Kubiak drew a direct comparison between the rookie and the All-Pro wideout, saying Horton’s skill set reminds him of Jefferson’s early career flashes. For a young player, such praise speaks volumes about his ceiling.Cooper Kupp’s underwhelming start, with just 136 yards and no touchdowns so far, has created an opening for Horton to carve out a bigger role.Smith-Njigba has lived up to expectations with solid production, but Horton’s versatility and explosiveness bring a new wrinkle to the offense.With Kubiak’s history of developing Jefferson into one of the league’s best receivers, Horton is in a prime situation to grow into a legitimate star. If his early performances are a sign of what’s ahead, the Seahawks may have found their next franchise wideout.Also Read: Kenneth Walker trade prediction: Why the Patriots could make a bold move for the Seahawks running back Tory Horton’s emergence adds excitement to Seattle’s future and raises the possibility that fans could be watching the beginning of another Justin Jefferson–like rise, only this time in a Seahawks uniform.
Article Summary: Rookie wide receiver Tory Horton is stealing headlines with his dynamic play. Horton has converted eight targets into five receptions for 64 yards and two touchdowns. He has also impressed on special teams with six punt returns totaling 156 yards. Offensive coordinator Klint Kubiak drew a direct comparison between Horton and All-Pro wideout Justin Jefferson.

They seem reluctant to hand a full-time, between-the-tackles role to Henderson at this early stage.”Adding Walker to the mix would immediately stabilize the Patriots’ offense. His power, balance, and ability to gain yards after contact make him an ideal complement to Henderson. Over his four NFL seasons, Walker has already compiled 2,749 rushing yards and 28 touchdowns—production that signals reliability.Also Read: Bills superstar Josh Allen shares his ultimate buffalo wings guide with one shocking underrated choice included If Bill Belichick and his staff want to avoid putting too much pressure on a rookie while also holding veterans accountable, Walker is the missing piece. Fans will most probably witness the competitive comeback of Woods as soon as he sufficiently regains fitness, which might well take place this year or 2026 in a PGA event.The absence of Woods in the Ryder Cup continues to be the shadow of his great legacy. Article Text:
76ers' Jared McCain is injured again (Image via AP Photo/Rick Bowmer)

Philadelphia Sixers guard Jared McCain faces setback with thumb injury ahead of season

Jared McCain’s injuries force Sixers to rethink backcourt rotation

According to ESPN's Tim Bontemps, Philadelphia 76ers ’ guard Jared McCain tore his right thumb's UCL during a workout on Thursday. The Sixers are now consulting with a doctor to decide how to treat the injury. McCain would probably be out for the start of the regular season because a tear of the UCL typically takes four to six weeks of rehabbing. However, the length of McCain's downtime is yet to be determined until the team knows how badly he's hurt. Meanwhile, he hasn’t addressed the injury as of yet.Guard Jared McCain was one Philadelphia 76ers player that many were eager to see return to action as the season got underway. It seems that his NBA sophomore season may get off to a rough start given previous events. The Philadelphia 76ers revealed less than 24 hours after the Media Day that guard Jared McCain tore his right thumb's ulnar collateral ligament (UCL) during a practice on Thursday.His availability for the season's opening was called into question when the team made the announcement. Tim Bontemps of ESPN reported on X:“Philadelphia 76ers guard Jared McCain suffered a UCL tear in his right thumb during a workout today, sources told ESPN.He and the team are working with specialists to decide how they will proceed, sources said. Philadelphia is set to hold media day tomorrow.…”In a press release, the Sixers formally announced the news as well. McCain has just been sidelined with a new injury. This happened shortly after he returned to the field following a ruptured meniscus that ended his first season.McCain was anticipated to contribute significantly to Philadelphia's campaign, either starting in the backcourt with All-Star Tyrese Maxey or coming off the bench. Article Title: “Not chasing Gretzky”: Alexander Ovechkin’s future questioned as analyst says breaking Wayne Gretzky’s record ended his drive
Article Text:
Alexander Ovechkin, having surpassed Wayne Gretzky's goal record in April 2025, now faces questions about his future motivation. Analyst Bryan Hayes suggests Ovechkin's drive may diminish without the record chase, also pointing to his age of 40 as a potential factor. Despite doubts, Ovechkin's legacy as a goal-scoring icon remains secure, approaching the 900-goal milestone.

Bryan Hayes questions Alex Ovechkin’s drive after chasing history

Alex Ovechkin’s legacy is secure even as questions linger



Alexander Ovechkin, one of the greatest goal scorers in NHL history, made hockey history earlier this year when he finally surpassed Wayne Gretzky’s long-standing record. On April 6, 2025, the Washington Capitals captain buried his 895th career goal against Ilya Sorokin, sending shockwaves through the sport. For many, that milestone cemented Ovi’s place alongside Gretzky in hockey immortality. But now that the chase is over, some wonder if the fire that fueled his career might be fading.Sports analyst Bryan Hayes recently offered a blunt assessment of Alex Ovechkin’s future. Appearing on SC with Jay Onrait, Hayes suggested that the Capitals’ leader may no longer have the same motivation that drove him to history.“He’s not chasing Gretzky anymore. Okay, so that’s not like a carrot hanging in front of him, where he was obsessed and he was scoring goals like crazy, and everything broke the Capitals’ way,” Hayes said. “They had a brilliant season, right? First place in the East. They had an unbelievable year, but I don’t see that happening again.”Hayes even hinted that Ovechkin’s age—40 years old—could mean the NHL is seeing the twilight of his career. “I think this is probably it. I think he’s done in the NHL. He’s 40 years old.”Despite the doubts, Ovechkin continues to defy expectations. He has racked up 1,623 career points across nearly 1,500 games and still ranked among the league’s top wingers last season.He currently sits at 897 goals, just three shy of the elusive 900 mark, which would set yet another historic milestone.Also Read: Tage Thompson’s future in Buffalo under scrutiny as Sabres’ struggles raise doubts Even if Hayes’ prediction proves correct, Ovechkin’s relentless pursuit of Gretzky’s record showcased his unmatched determination and cemented a legacy that will never be forgotten. Whether or not his swan song is near, fans will always remember the “Great 8” as the player who redefined goal-scoring greatness.
Article Summary: Alexander Ovechkin surpassed Wayne Gretzky's goal record in April 2025. Sports analyst Bryan Hayes suggests Ovi's drive may diminish without the record chase. Hayes also points to the 40-year-old's age as a potential factor. Despite doubts, his legacy as a goal-scoring icon remains secure.

Article Title: India drop Karun Nair for West Indies Test matches - here's why
Article Text:
Karun Nair made a return to Test cricket after a long time but couldn't make it count.

India's chief selector Ajit Agarkar announced the 15-member Test squad for the upcoming two-match series against West Indies, with Shubman Gill appointed as captain and Ravindra Jadeja as vice-captain.The announcement, made on Thursday, revealed the exclusion of batter Karun Nair, while newcomers Sai Sudharsan and Devdutt Padikkal received call-ups for the series scheduled to begin on October 2 in Ahmedabad.The selection committee's decision to drop Karun Nair came after his recent performance in England, where he managed only one half-century in four Test matches."Frankly, we expected a little bit more. I mean, he's played four Tests. That's the way it is, I mean, we feel (Devdutt) Padikkal offers a little bit more at this point. And I wish we could give everyone 15 or 20 Tests. Unfortunately, it doesn't work that way. Padikkal's been in the Test squad. I mean, he was in the Test squad in Australia, played in Dharamshala against England, got a 50 there. So he's shown some decent form with India," said Agarkar in the press conference to announce the squad in Dubai."Frankly, we expected a bit more from Karun on the England trip there," he added.The series comprises two Test matches, with the first match scheduled at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on October 2, followed by the second Test at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi on October 10.India squad for West Indies series: Shubman Gill (captain), Ravindra Jadeja (vice-captain), Yashasvi Jaiswal , KL Rahul, Sai Sudharsan, Devdutt Padikkal, Dhruv Jurel, Washington Sundar, Jasprit Bumrah, Axar Patel, Nitish Kumar Reddy, Mohammed Siraj, Prasidh Krishna, Kuldeep Yadav, Narayan Jagadeeshan

Dallas Stars captain Jamie Benn will undergo a major surgery to treat a collapsed lung, general manager Jim Nill confirmed on Thursday. Article Title: Marvin Harrison Jr.’s relief and excitement captured perfectly after stunning 4th-quarter touchdown vs. Seahawks
Article Text:

Marvin Harrison Jr.’s impact in crunch time



Rebuilding momentum for the Cardinals



Marvin Harrison Jr. experienced a rollercoaster night as the Arizona Cardinals hosted the Seattle Seahawks on Thursday Night Football. The second-year wide receiver struggled early with drops, including a costly miscue in the second quarter that led to a Seahawks interception. Despite the rough start, Harrison delivered a clutch 16-yard touchdown grab from Kyler Murray in the fourth quarter, giving the Cardinals a chance to fight back and showing flashes of the form that made him last year’s No. 4 overall pick.Marvin Harrison Jr.’s performance says what he can bring under pressure. The 23-year-old receiver, who had 10 receptions on 17 targets for 142 yards and a touchdown in the first three games of 2025, added six catches for 66 yards and a score on 10 targets against Seattle. His 16-yard touchdown came with just under six minutes remaining, cutting the Cardinals’ deficit to 20-13 and reigniting hope in State Farm Stadium. Harrison also made an 18-yard catch on the next drive, setting up a game-tying opportunity.“This was the moment he was looking for,” a source close to the team said. Harrison’s former Ohio State teammates remain confident in his ability to rebound, and Thursday’s performance could mark the turning point in his sophomore season.Though Arizona ultimately fell 23-20, Harrison’s late-game heroics offer a morale boost for a team sitting at 2-2. Head coach Jonathan Gannon has high expectations for the second-year star, viewing him as a potential top target in the offense. Harrison’s rookie season set a high bar with 62 catches, 885 yards, and eight touchdowns, but consistency has been the missing link in 2025. Thursday’s clutch plays against a strong Seattle squad, led by Sam Darnold’s 123 first-half yards, suggest he is finding his stride.Looking ahead, the Cardinals will aim to carry Harrison’s momentum into their next matchup against the Tennessee Titans on October 5. If he continues to capitalize on opportunities in critical moments, Harrison could prove to be the offensive spark Arizona needs for the rest of the season.
